review_blob:
Better than most "industrial" lagers. Color: pale, clear. Taste medium bitterness with no special character. Average carbonation. 
Ok to have a pint in the pub...
Not an American IPA. Not an English IPA. Quite unique: Fruity with the "well-known" citrus note - i.e. Cascade & Amarillo are really present here! With just 5.5% ABV not really "dangerous" ;-) Good!
A little bit too sweet to my taste. Also, quite strong yeasty nose - too much for an amber beer. Not really "round". All in all ok - but not outstanding.
Great, not over-hoppy IPA. Taste and palate totally match. The use of Citra as the only hops is a.... winner ;-)

Great new beer from the small Belgian "Silly brewery". 
Far better than the normal "Silly Pils". Smooth, neither too hoppy nor too malty - and quite light. In my opinion: A perfect "everyday beer".
